babel-plugin-check-es2015-constants

Validate ES2015 constants (prevents reassignment of const variables).

Example

In

js const a = 1; a = 2;

Out

bash repl: "a" is read-only 1 | const a = 1; > 2 | a = 2; | ^

Try in REPL

Installation

sh npm install --save-dev babel-plugin-check-es2015-constants

Usage

Via .babelrc (Recommended)

.babelrc

json { "plugins": ["check-es2015-constants"] }

Via CLI

sh babel --plugins check-es2015-constants script.js

Via Node API

javascript require("babel-core").transform("code", { plugins: ["check-es2015-constants"] });

Note

This check will only validate consts. If you need it to compile down to var then you must also install and enable transform-es2015-block-scoping.
